title: Artificial intelligence
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is intelligence demonstrated by machines, in contrast to natural intelligence displayed by humans and animals.

content.text: Artificial intelligence (AI) is intelligence demonstrated by machines, in contrast to natural intelligence displayed by humans and animals. Leading AI textbooks define the field as the study of "intelligent agents": any device that perceives its environment and takes actions that maximize its chance of successfully achieving its goals.

The field of AI research was founded at a workshop at Dartmouth College in 1956, where the term "artificial intelligence" was first coined. Early development included game-playing programs and theorem provers.

references.text: Russell, Stuart; Norvig, Peter (2010). Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach. Prentice Hall.
